name: **Ilaunmaan – _Oileán Meana_**
description: Ilaunmaan – Oileán Meana L827-276 Sheet 44 Small, low-lying rocky island with grassy top lying mid-way between Ardmore Point and Illauneeragh. Landing at HW at NW into cove, and at lower waters in stony cove to N. Grazed by sheep. Tides run strongly around the island. Small cairn on its highest point. Evidence of breeding Common and Lesser and Great Black backed Gull and roosting spot for Cormorant and Shags. Useful way-stop (even lunch point) for kayakers touring outer Kilkieran Bay. No water.
